newsitem.title: USA: Murdoch gains entry to U.S. satellite TV market.
newsitem.headline: Murdoch gains entry to U.S. satellite TV market.

text.p: Rupert Murdoch's News Corp. will gain entry to the U.S. satellite television market through a restructuring announced today by PrimeStar Partners.

PrimeStar, a satellite-dish TV service owned by the biggest U.S. cable operators, said it would restructure into a public company that will include U.S. satellite assets from News Corp and MCI Communications Corp.
The deal follows News Corp's failed efforts to join forces with EchoStar Communications Corp. Their proposed $1 billion deal has dissolved into a morass of litigation.

"I couldn't quite say this is a replacement, but because that (Echo) deal didn't work out, this is the next one we're doing," News Corp spokesman Jim Platt said in a telephone interview. "This is a way for us to recoup our investment in the satellites."

Under the new ownership structure, the current PrimeStar partners will contribute their partnership interests and their PrimeStar subscribers to the new public company, PrimeStar Inc, in return for a combination of stock and cash.

In exchange for the satellites, News Corp and MCI will receive a non-voting stake in PrimeStar Inc. They will get non-voting convertible securities with a liquidation value of about $1.1 billion, PrimeStar said in a press release.

PrimeStar currently has 1.8 million satellite subscribers. It said the addition of the News Corp.-MCI satellites gives it the ability to compete in the fast-growing small-dish segment of the direct broadcast satellite market.
The transactions are subject to regulatory approval, PrimeStar said.

James Gray, PrimeStar Partners chairman and chief executive officer, will be chairman and chief executive officer of PrimeStar Inc. until the restructuring is completed. Then Daniel O'Brien, president of Time Warner Satellite Services Inc., will become president and chief operating officer of the new company.
The PrimeStar partners are Time Warner Inc., Tele-Communications Inc., Cox Communications, U S West Media Group, Comcast Corp., and General Electric Co.'s GE American Communications Inc.
